description: From French narghilé, from Turkish nargile, from Persian نارگیله‎ (nârgile) from نارگیل‎ (nârgil, “coconut”), which used to be used to construct the bowl, likely ultimately from Sanskrit नारिकेल (nārikela, “coconut”), from a Dravidian language.

entries.meaning: A large Oriental tobacco pipe wherein the smoke is drawn through water to filter and cool it.
